title: Enrichment Approval Workbench & Enhanced Layout
description: Major UI improvements moving enrichment approval to dedicated workbench view and enhancing the overall workbench layout for better space utilization and user experience.

features.name: Enrichment Approval Workbench View
features.description: Moved enrichment approval from modal dialog to dedicated workbench tab. Provides more space for reviewing enrichment proposals, better organization, and seamless integration with the workbench workflow. Automatically switches to enrichment view after file/folder uploads.

features.name: Collapsible Project Sidebar
features.description: Left sidebar with project listings can now be collapsed to provide more space for the workbench content. Toggle button allows quick show/hide of the project pane.

features.name: Resizable Agent Chat Panel
features.description: Agent chat moved to bottom panel with draggable resizer. Users can adjust the relative height of the agent panel and workbench content by dragging the divider. Minimum height constraints ensure usability.

features.name: Meaningful Project Names
features.description: Project names now display meaningful names extracted from classification reasoning or trigger descriptions. UUIDs are formatted as 'Project {shortId}' with full ID available in tooltip.

features.name: Map View Bug Fixes
features.description: Fixed D3 force simulation error when links reference nodes that don't exist in the current dataset. Links are now filtered to only include valid source/target pairs, preventing 'node not found' errors.

features.name: Enhanced Enrichment Flow
features.description: Improved enrichment proposal fetching with thread_id query parameter support. Better error handling and logging for debugging enrichment issues. Seamless integration with folder upload workflow.

title: Unified Observability & GitHub-Native Persistence
description: Major observability upgrade with end-to-end distributed tracing and GitHub API-based data persistence, eliminating dependency on local file system and git operations.

features.name: OpenTelemetry & LangSmith Integration
features.description: Full end-to-end distributed tracing from frontend through backend to LangGraph. Client-side OpenTelemetry Web SDK captures thread operations and HTTP requests, with automatic trace context propagation via traceparent headers. All traces unified in LangSmith for comprehensive observability.

features.name: GitHub-Native File Storage
features.description: Branding and project model data now persist directly via GitHub Contents API (similar to GitHub issues), eliminating reliance on local file writes and git commits. Automatic fallback to MCP git server when GitHub storage is disabled. Controlled by USE_GITHUB_STORAGE environment variable.

features.name: Thread-Aware Tracing
features.description: Enhanced trace correlation with thread ID extraction from URL paths, query parameters, and request bodies. Thread IDs automatically included in LangSmith metadata for unified diagnostics across frontend, proxy, and LangGraph operations.

features.name: AI Trace Compatibility
features.description: Client-side spans include placeholder GenAI and LLM attributes (gen_ai.*, llm.*) to mimic AI traces, ensuring proper recognition and processing by LangSmith's OpenTelemetry endpoint. All LangSmith-recognized attributes configured per official documentation.

features.name: Server-Side Next.js Instrumentation
features.description: Automatic server-side OpenTelemetry instrumentation for Next.js API routes, capturing HTTP method, route, target, and status code. Nested span visualization for complete request lifecycle tracking.

features.name: Proxy Trace Context Propagation
features.description: Proxy server extracts and propagates OpenTelemetry trace context from client requests, creating proxy.request spans as children of client spans. Explicit OTEL trace/span ID injection into LangGraph metadata for seamless correlation.

title: Rich Versioning & Human-in-the-Loop Diff Review
description: Major upgrade bringing full historical visibility, semantic diffs, and enhanced model stability.

features.name: Artifact & KG Versioning
features.description: Explorable history for artifacts and Knowledge Graph (KG vX badge). View past iterations directly in the sidebar with read-only previews.

features.name: Advanced Diff Review
features.description: Rich Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) approval flow. New nodes are highlighted in Green, modified in Amber, and removed in Red. AI-generated semantic summaries for large changes.

features.name: Commit History Integration
features.description: Knowledge Graph versioning now uses GitHub commit history instead of separate version files. Commit messages displayed as friendly version names with SHA as secondary text. Timeline view shows all KG versions with commit metadata.

features.name: Diff Visualization
features.description: Visual comparison of Knowledge Graph versions with color-coded nodes (green for added, yellow for modified, red for removed). Diff summary shows counts of changes. Full dataset loaded for accurate comparison.
